alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:31PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Casey and northeastern Adair Counties through 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/... At 631 PM EDT/531 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Columbia, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Casey and northeastern Adair Counties, including the following locations... Knifley, Clementsville, Pellyton, Dunnville, Rubert Ford, Casey Creek, Evans Ford, Evona, Rheber and Pricetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
